review_title: Most disorganized establishment Ive worked at
pros: One pro about working at Homestart is that it is an easy job, you don't really do much and have a lot of flexibility and time. On the other hand this is what makes it a terrible place to work at .
cons: Terrible management, it didn't even make sense why the team leads were hired a team leads. Very incompetent managers and never did their jobs, a lot of my coworkers and I didn't feel supported and there was little to no training. New hires would beg to be given tasks, it was awful.

review_title: Meaningful work; not a livable wage
job_title: Family Support Specialist in San Diego, CA
pros: Relationships with families are so impactful & you feel like you are making a difference. The diversity in the families that you work with & the training that you receive beforehand is amazing. The other family support specialists are wonderful people and make the office feel like a family. It was all women in the office and the best work environment I’ve ever been a part of. Work/Life balance is great!
cons: Not a livable wage! I would qualify for the services that I’m providing to low income families. This is why there is so much turnover & no one stays long. I could make more working fast food and I have a college degree in child life and child development. There are no opportunities for growth or increase in salary. After working there for 1.5 years; i never received a pay increase and could no longer survive on that income.

pros: Great work for the community, really dedicated staff at all levels.
cons: Some agencies pay a little higher, but the benefits are really good here and paid holiday break and 401K Match

job_title: Housing Specialist in San Diego, CA
pros: Work independently. Able to assist a great community in need.
cons: Overworked their employees. Little support from management.

pros:
-amazing coworkers and support system

pros: Good healthcare plan, vacation accrues quickly, depending on which department there's some wonderful people
cons: Disorganized leadership, very high turnover, lots of staff/department gossip, difficult field to work in, lack of direct staff support, low pay for the amount of work asked of staff

pros: Great work in a good cause
cons: Communication is difficult across the UK

job_title: Case Manager in San Diego, CA
pros: Flexible schedule, coworkers are supportive, great starting place to gain experience
cons: Lack of training, disorganized leadership, high retention

pros: Job role is varied and enjoyable. Everyday is different and can bring all kinds of challenges, but knowing that you are supporting families in need is very rewarding.
cons: Low pay. could offer more training opportunities.

pros: The AAP's provides great and ongoing trainings and resources.
cons: A lot of repeated paperwork required!

pros: Great benefits the company pays for it. Great maternity leave/ family leave . 120 hours sick time the first year you work there . Pto is not that great only ten days the first year.
cons: Nothing much he does a great job

pros: Struggling a bit here...the aim of the org is obviously good. Good place for lead-swingers, bureaucrats and the subordinate
cons: Like working in one of those historical re-enactment places. Change resistant doesn't even hint at it.  If you're comfortable working in an upstairs downstairs environment, insane levels of bureaucracy and admin with no prospects for advancement, apply within.  PS as a newcomer you will be 'downstairs'.

job_title: Case Manager in San Diego, CA
pros: Work is rewarding, you get to make a positive difference in peoples lives and work with others who want to make a positive difference
cons: Pay is low, raises are low and you are given a lot of work

pros: It's a charity that does good in the community
cons: Too much red tape but that's the down side of having to report to everyone.  Not open with the staff.

job_title: Volunteer in Richmond upon Thames, England
pros: Training course was great, met some lovely people. Helping families as a volunteer was fulfilling and confidence building.
cons: None, the organisation is well set up and volunteers are supported and cared for.

job_title: Business Consultant in Boynton Beach, FL
pros: Great management, inviting work enviornment, above average work satisfaction
cons: Small, not growing, vonerable, no benefits, consultant versus full time

pros: Fulfilling work, opportunity to expand your skills
cons: grant funding is unpredictable, commonplace in social service agencies

pros: Excellent place to work, and great values
